quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Nicolas Cage and Sitcom
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, facts. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the character, portrayed by Nicolas cage in The Rock?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stanley Goodspeed

questions.question: I played Tootie on the Facts of Life. I was often seen on roller skates. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kim Fields

questions.question: In what movie did Nicolas Cage portray Ben Sanderson, a depressed alcoholic screenwriter?

options.text: Fear and Loathing In Las Vegas

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leaving Las Vegas

questions.question: I played Monica E. Gellar (a chef) on the sitcom Friends. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Courteney Cox-Arquette

questions.question: Actor Nicolas Cage is a high school drop-out.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: I played Arnie Grape, a handicapped boy in Whats Eating Gilbert Grape? Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leonardo DiCaprio

questions.question: I played Rose Nylund from St. Olaf, Minnesota on the sitcom The Golden Girls. I was the quietest one of the four roommates. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Betty White

questions.question: I played Chachi (Fonzies cousin) on the sitcom Happy Days. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scott Baio

questions.question: In what time-travel film did Nicolas Cage play Charlie Bodell, lead singer of a high school band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peggy Sue Got Married

questions.question: Nicolas Cage co-starred in a movie opposite his then-wife, Patricia Arquette.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the name of Nicolas Cages son born on December 26, 1990?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Weston

questions.question: What was the name Nicolas Cages character in City Of Angels?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seth

questions.question: Gary Coleman played Willis on the sitcom Different Strokes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Did Nicolas Cage appear in Fast Times At Ridgemont High?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: I played a writer named Jack Torrance, who moves into the Overlook Hotel with his wife (Wendy) and son (Danny). Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Nicholson

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Hilary Duff and Stars
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, stars, duffs. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which one of these movies did Zac Efron star in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: High School Musical

questions.question: I was born in 1976 and got my first break in a movie called The Man in The Moon in 1991. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reese Witherspoon

questions.question: Success came to Hilary Duff as she took the role of the starring title character in this  #1 Disney Channel Hit Series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lizzie McGuire

questions.question: Who are Hilarys Parents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob and Susan

questions.question: In 2005 Hilary Duff starred in a sequel to which 2003 movie of hers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cheaper by the Dozen

questions.question: I was born February 28, 1961 in Edmonton, Alberta. My father is Chinese and Scotch-Irish while my mother is African American and Cherokee. My 2nd husband was actor C. Thomas Howell and we divorced in 1990.  Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rae Dawn Chong

questions.question: Which one of these stars appeared in all of the following movies: Hide and Seek, Dreamer, Nine Lives, The Cat in the Hat, and Uptown Girls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dakota Fanning

questions.question: Lindsay Lohan starred in Mean Girls.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: I was born in April of 1900 and died just 17 days after the filming of my last movie was completed. Some of my co-stars included Katharine Hepburn, Elizabeth Taylor, Mickey Rooney and Gene Kelly. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spencer Tracy

questions.question: I was born in 1956 on the island of Cuba and my family immigrated to the United States in 1961. Some of my co-stars on the big screen have been Meg Ryan, George Clooney and Ray Liotta. Who am I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Andy Garcia

questions.question: Was Joel Madden, lead singer for Good Charlotte ever Hilary Duffs boyfriend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: In which of these films did Hilary Duff star?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of the Above

questions.question: Hilary Duffs real hair color is blonde
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of the following movies did Hilary Duff not play in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Undiscovered

questions.question: Hilary Duff has done charity work for Kids With a Cause.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Father and Grandfather

questions.question: Daniel Radcliffe is the star of what popular movie(s)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Potter

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christopher Guest

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: D. H. Lawrence, the British author  of  Sons and Lovers,  was married to Frieda Weekley whose cousin gained fame for his heroism during World War I. What was his name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Red Baron von Richthofen

questions.question: Oscar-winning screenwriter Budd Schulberg, who penned both On the Waterfront  and A Face in the Crowd, is the son of B.P. Schulberg, who ran which Hollywood studio during the 1930s?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eragon

questions.question: Tinkerbell is the famous pet of which celebrity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paris Hilton

questions.question: Max Born, a German mathematician and physicist who won a Nobel Prize in 1954, was the grandfather of  what pop vocalist?

questions.question: Her grandfather Frank was not only a high-ranking amateur tennis player who made it to the finals of Wimbledon, but he also co-starred with Mickey Rooney in a 1937 movie.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brooke Shields

questions.question: Which of the following songs was performed by Paris Hilton?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stars Are Blind

questions.question: TV actor and director Anson Potsie Williams is the nephew of this medical doctor who developed a procedure for drowning rescue and for treating asthma.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Henry Heimlich

questions.question: Who sang the song Come Back to Me, released in 2006?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanessa Anne Hudgens

questions.question: This darling of the American TV sitcom world, famous for her role in Seinfeld, is unlikely to have pursued success purely for monetary reasons, since her father was reported to be a billionaire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Julia Louis-Dreyfus

questions.question: In this 1986  movie Tom Cruise performed all his billiards shots except one, where he had to jump two balls to sink another. The director wanted him to learn this trick but it would have taken a couple of days, thus costing thousands of dollars extra.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Color of Money

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Arnold Schwarzenegger and Movie

questions.question: In 1986, Arnold Schwarzenegger married the actress Brigitte Nielsen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In this movie a real sword was used as the fake one broke in the sequence. In one scene the sword came within an inch of Toms neck.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Last Samurai

questions.question: After a long career as a professional bodybuilder, Arnold began to pursue a career as an actor. His first movie appearance was in Conan the Barbarian.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Schwarzenegger has been a Republican ever since he came to the US. In 2003 he became the Governor of California, serving the remainder of this mans term.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gray Davis

questions.question: Arnold Schwarzenegger worked in the United Kingdom for a while, before he moved to the US in this year. He had only $20 in his pocket and could not speak English very well.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1968

questions.question: This is Tom Cruises film with the greatest number of errors, 109.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Top Gun

questions.question: In 1992, Arnold Schwarzenegger became the first owner of a Hummer vehicle manufactured for civilian use (this is true). The original Hummer was so large, that it was classified as a large truck.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Schwarzenegger first became famous as a bodybuilder. He won the titles of Junior Mr. Europe, Mr. World, IFBB Mr. Universe, NABBA Mr. Universe (four times), and Mr. Olympia (seven times). What was the moniker that he earned?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Austrian Oak

questions.question: In 1996, he became the first actor in history to star in five consecutive films that grossed $100 million in USA.  The films were A Few Good Men (1992), The Firm (1993), Interview with the Vampire (1994), Mission: Impossible (1996) and this 1996 movie.

options.text: Born on the Fourth of July

questions.question: Arnold Schwarzenegger and Danny De Vito played together in this movie. Their characters were brothers, raised separately at different locations, not knowing about each other.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Twins (1988)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Muscle maintenance

questions.question: Tom caused a big stir among the medical society when he declared that his dyslexia was cured with the help of this new religion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scientology

questions.question: Arnold Alois Schwarzenegger was born in Thal, Austria on 30 July in the same year Carlos Santana was born. Which year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1947

questions.question: The parents of Arnold - Gustav Schwarzenegger and Aurelia Jadrny, were persecuted by the Nazi party.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False
